list_definition.definition: a barrel for holding liquids, usually wine

list_ex_of_english: In line 35 it refers to the need for wooden casks.
It seems strange that, if one conveys liquid in tanks, one gets the grant but if it is in casks one does not.
There it is: a series of digits that clearly identify the brand, the bottling line, the distillery and the cask.
These casks are similar to those in which wine has been shipped from other sources of supply during war-time.
Its fragrance, when the cask is pierced, overpowers the assembly.
Whisky can be left in a bottle or a cask and there can be no increase in the alcoholic content.
The wine of politics has matured in the cask, and sometimes has fermented.
The company has been informed that it is not possible to introduce a special exemption in favour of these casks.
